name: Lost Trails //02
description:
´Lost Trails //02´
4726px x 3172px 300dpi JPG

35mm expired Ilford HP5 film originals.
Nikon F2 1975 + Nikkor 50mm 1.4 lens.
Re-photographed inside Beseler enlarger directly to light via Nikon D750 + Nikkor Macro 55mm lens.
1/1

This photographic series depicts the collapse of the train system in Argentina. Drifting among the disused material, attracting unexpected currents. The past glories cross the abandoned space, abounding in permeability of emotions. What or who do we estimate our achievements by? How far will we be able to flood this world with failures?

Trajectories survive gravitational forces, as an achievement in depersonalization. The subtlety of the monochromatic composition explores the cavity of emotions.

A policy of non-intervention, explores the moment in its natural state, as a unique event, in its formal presentation. Undoing the body, the camera, in a depersonalization achievement. Becoming-imperceptible to recover the secret.

The art of disappearing in the instant, to reveal the underlaying flavors.
